name: client-connectrpc

jsDoc.doc:
ConnectRPC/gRPC status codes.
These codes are used by both gRPC and ConnectRPC protocols.
Human-readable names for ConnectRPC/gRPC status codes.
Get the name of a ConnectRPC/gRPC status code.
Check if a number is a valid ConnectRPC/gRPC status code.

tags.doc:
```typescript
isConnectRpcStatusCode(0);   // true
isConnectRpcStatusCode(16);  // true
isConnectRpcStatusCode(99);  // false
```

jsDoc.doc:
Rich error detail from google.rpc.Status.

ConnectRPC errors can include structured details encoded in error responses.
These details follow the google.protobuf.Any format with a type URL and value.

Type URL identifying the error detail type.
Common types include:
- "type.googleapis.com/google.rpc.BadRequest"
- "type.googleapis.com/google.rpc.DebugInfo"
- "type.googleapis.com/google.rpc.RetryInfo"
- "type.googleapis.com/google.rpc.QuotaFailure"

Decoded error detail value.
The structure depends on the typeUrl.
Options for ConnectRpcError construction.
Headers/metadata from the ConnectRPC response.
Rich error details from google.rpc.Status.
Base error class for ConnectRPC/gRPC errors.
Error thrown when the client is not authenticated (code 16).
Error thrown when the client lacks permission (code 7).
Error thrown when the requested resource is not found (code 5).
Error thrown when a resource is exhausted (code 8).
Error thrown for internal server errors (code 13).
Error thrown when the service is unavailable (code 14).
Convert ConnectRPC's ConnectError to ConnectRpcError.

tags.doc: Appropriate ConnectRpcError subclass based on error code

jsDoc.doc:
FileDescriptorSet message type from @bufbuild/protobuf.
This is the decoded protobuf message containing file descriptors.
Protocol to use for ConnectRPC transport.
HTTP version for transport.
TLS configuration for ConnectRPC connections.
Root CA certificate (PEM format).
Client certificate (PEM format).
Client private key (PEM format).
Skip server certificate verification (use only for testing).

ConnectRPC connection configuration.

Extends CommonConnectionConfig with ConnectRPC-specific options.
Protocol to use.
Service path prefix.
Configuration for creating a ConnectRPC client.

Server URL for ConnectRPC connections.

Can be a URL string or a connection configuration object.
Protocol to use.
HTTP version to use.
TLS configuration. If not provided, uses insecure credentials.
Default metadata to send with every request.

Schema resolution configuration.
- "reflection": Use Server Reflection to discover services dynamically (default)
- string: Path to FileDescriptorSet binary file (from `buf build --output set.binpb`)
- Uint8Array: FileDescriptorSet binary data
- FileDescriptorSet: Pre-parsed FileDescriptorSet message object
Whether to use binary format for messages.

Whether to throw ConnectRpcError on non-OK responses (code !== 0).
Can be overridden per-request via ConnectRpcOptions.throwOnError.
Options for individual ConnectRPC calls.
Metadata to send with the request.

Whether to throw ConnectRpcError on non-OK responses (code !== 0).
Overrides ConnectRpcClientConfig.throwOnError.

tags.value: @default true (when not specified in client config)

jsDoc.doc: Service information from reflection.
Fully qualified service name (e.g., "echo.EchoService")
Proto file name
Method information from reflection.
Method name (e.g., "Echo")
Local name (camelCase)
Method kind
Input message type name
Output message type name
Whether the method is idempotent
Detailed service information.
Service name
Fully qualified service name
Package name
Proto file name
All methods
ConnectRPC response interface.

Get deserialized response data.
Returns the response message as-is (already deserialized by Connect).
Returns null if the response is an error or has no data.
Get raw response message.
Result type identifier
Whether the request was successful (code === 0).
ConnectRPC/gRPC status code.
Status message (empty string for successful responses).
Response headers
Response trailers (sent at end of RPC)
Response time in milliseconds.
Options for creating a ConnectRpcResponse.
Implementation of ConnectRpcResponse.
Fluent assertion interface for ConnectRpcResponse.
Verify that status is OK (code === 0).
Verify that status is not OK.
Verify the exact status code.
Verify the status code is one of the specified values.
Verify the status code is not one of the specified values.
Verify the error message matches exactly or by regex.
Verify the error message contains the substring.
Verify the error message using a custom matcher.
Verify a header value matches exactly or by regex.
Verify that a header exists.
Verify that a header value contains the substring.
Verify a header value using a custom matcher.
Verify a trailer value matches exactly or by regex.
Verify that a trailer exists.
Verify that a trailer value contains the substring.
Verify a trailer value using a custom matcher.
Verify that data() is null.
Verify that data() is not null.
Verify that data() contains the specified properties (deep partial match).
Verify data() using a custom matcher.
Verify that response duration is less than the threshold.

Create a fluent assertion chain for ConnectRPC response validation.

Returns an expectation object with chainable assertion methods.
Each assertion throws an Error if it fails, making it ideal for testing.

tags.doc:
Performance assertions
```ts
expectConnectRpcResponse(response)
  .ok()
  .durationLessThan(500);  // Must respond within 500ms
```

Only available when client is created with schema: "reflection".

jsDoc.doc: Check if reflection is enabled.
ConnectRPC client interface.
Make a unary RPC call.
Make a server streaming RPC call.
Make a client streaming RPC call.
Make a bidirectional streaming RPC call.
Close the client connection.
Client configuration
Reflection API (only available when schema: "reflection")

Create a new ConnectRPC client instance.

The client supports multiple protocols (Connect, gRPC, gRPC-Web) and provides
Server Reflection for runtime service discovery without compile-time code generation.

tags.name: config
tags.doc: - Client configuration including server URL and protocol options
